tophersmith.security.headers.csp.directives

Class AbstractCSPDirective

  • java.lang.Object
    • tophersmith.security.headers.csp.directives.AbstractCSPDirective
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractSrcDirective, ExperimentalDirective, FrameAncestorsDirective, PluginTypesDirective, ReportUriDirective, SandboxDirective

    public abstract class AbstractCSPDirective
extends Object
    The AbstractCSPDirective is the base implementation for all directive values It handles basic validation and managing incoming directive values
    Author:
    Chris Smith

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected List<String> directiveValues
      The list of RFC-compliance directive values
      protected List<String> experimentalValues
      The list of non-RFC-compliance directive values
      protected String name
      The name of the directive

        value - a directive value to add

        public void addExperimentalValue(String value)

      • validateSourceListValue

        protected void validateSourceListValue(String val,
                                       CSPValidationReport report)
        Validate a given directive value as a source-list. Report any validation errors to the provided report
        Parameters:
        val - a directive value to validate
        report - a validation report to hold any issues discovered

      • hasValidCharacters

        protected boolean hasValidCharacters(String val,
                                     CSPValidationReport report)
        Test if a given value does not contain any invalid characters. If the value contains an invalid character, a report message is filed
        Parameters:
        val - a String to test
        report - a validation report to hold any issues discovered
        Returns:
        true if the value contains only legal values, false otherwise

      • isValidKeyword

        protected boolean isValidKeyword(String val)
        Validate any Keywords associated with this directive
        Parameters:
        val - a directive value to validate
        Returns:
        true if this keyword is valid, false if it isn't or doesn't exist

        public String buildDirective()
        Convert this directive into a proper string representation including the experimental ones
        Returns:
        a string representation of this directive

        protected String buildDirectiveValue()
        Construct the directive line including the experimental ones
        Returns:
        the directive line describing this directive

        Build the normal directive values including the experimental ones

        Returns:

        Within this directive, remove any duplicate values

      • validateAndReport

        public abstract void validateAndReport(CSPValidationReport report)
        For this CSPDirective, ensure all values are correctly set up for the directive and add validation errors to the provided CSPValidationReport
        Parameters:
        report - a validation report to hold any issues discovered
